DuPont Circle Office Building
13U6 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Harold:
Very briefly, in answer to your request of March 21, this is
the substance of Dr. Schwarzwalderfs position on the subjects
discussed at the Milwaukee Board Meeting as presented by Vogl
and me:
1. Legal representation and the Channel 12 situation
The NAEB performed very badly in this matter and has
placed itself in the ridiculous position of declining
assistance to an important member organization in a
dispute in which NAEB should have been a pillar of
strength and leadership. The very name of the organ¬
ization clearly states that it is an association of
Educational Broadcasters. The stated purpose of the
organization also makes clear its role in such cases.
There should not even be a question of what policy to
follow. There does, however, seem to be confusion
over the role of the NAEB Legal Counsel in the matter.
Despite that firm!s long and loyal tenure, is it not
possible that its welfare has become confused with
NAEB*s? Legal Counsel does not make policy nor should
the awareness of Legal Counsel*s other interests
affect NAEB*s policy. NAEB must support its member
organizations and, where necessary, seek other counsel
to assist in the implementation of that policy. The
fact of NAEB’s timorous vacillation in this matter
which offered the perfect opportunity for NETRC to
dramatically step in on the side of WHYY-TV — thus
further illustrating nAEB*s weakness and indecision —
can now only be painfully reassessed with the hope that
it might awake the organization to sharpen its thinking
and its action on behalf of all its membership.
